intro: Knema ashtonii var. cinnamomea, commonly known as the cinnamon knema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and leathery, elliptic leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense rainforest vegetation. Its bark and leaves contain aromatic compounds, which contribute to its ecological and potential medicinal significance.
